content:
What is the MOST common term for the type of energy that is most
directly related to the energy of atoms, molecules and other small particles that are in random motion
within a system?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
In electrochemical cells, what is the most common term for the electrode
that acts as the negative electrode?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
If the electronegativity difference in the bonding atoms is large, what
general type of bond is formed?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following molecules has a double covalent bond:
W) hydrogen
X) oxygen
Y) nitrogen
Z) methane
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following BEST describes the function of the golgi (read
as: GOAL-gee) complex:
W) metabolism of carbohydrates
X) production of peroxides
Y) modification and packaging of proteins for exocytosis
Z) storage of lipids
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) MODIFICATION AND PACKAGING OF PROTEINS FOR EXOCYTOSIS

content:
Most corticosteroids are synthesized in what specific part of the human
body?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Simplify the following, giving your answer in proper scientific notation: (6.0
× 1012)(2.0 × 1010)2
subject: MATH

content: Factor the following expression completely: 81x2 + 180xy + 100y2
subject: MATH

content:
In the oceans, waves and surf currents are generated by:
W) wind
X) El-Nino
Y) salinity and temperature gradients
Z) the Intertropical Convergence Zone
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
What is the name for the common ocean waves that are not driven
by the wind but sustained by the energy they obtained by the sea?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
A hexadecimal number is a numeral system with a radix or a
base of what?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Convert a pressure of 1.2 atmospheres into millimeters
mercury:
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: 912(Solution: 1.2 atm × 760 mmHg/1 atm = 912 mmHg)High School Round 3 Page 3

content:
The temperature of a star can be estimated most directly from its:
W) distance
X) elemental makeup
Y) color
Z) density
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
The local group is generally referred to as a collection of what
celestial objects?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: What is the SI unit of electric charge?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Giving your answer in kilometers per hour per second, what is the average
acceleration of a truck traveling on a straight road from 10 kilometers per hour to 50 kilometers per hour
in 1 minute and 20 seconds:
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What is the name for the most malleable and ductile metal which can
be dissolved in aqua regia but is unaffected by air and most other reagents?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the molecular formula for the conjugate acid of the following
Brønsted-Lowry base: SO 2–
4
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the MOST common term for the division of a somatic cell into 2
nucleated cells following of mitosis?
subject: BIOLOGY

content: What is the anticodon on a tRNA for AAA (read as: A, A, A)?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Find the following product, giving your answer in standard form:
(4x3 + x)(7x3 + 4x2)
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following cloud types is classified as a low
cloud:
W) altostratus
X) cirrostratus
Y) cumulonimbus
Z) nimbostratus
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Panning is a simple mining technique that is used for
extracting gold deposited in:
W) banded gold formations
X) evaporite deposits
Y) placer deposits
Z) lode deposits
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Y) PLACER DEPOSITSHigh School Round 3 Page 6

content:
The lush forest of the Pacific northwest is classified as what
type of rain forest?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
The reaction of lead oxide in the presence of what acid is
fundamental to the operation of the lead-acid rechargeable battery found in most cars?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: SULFURIC ACID (ACCEPT: SULFURIC or H SO )2 4

content:
The stars Merak and Dubhe in the bowl of the big dipper are most
commonly used to locate what star?
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: POLARIS (ACCEPT: POLE STAR; NORTH STAR; ALPHA URSA MINORIS)

content:
The main asteroid belt is located immediately between what two
planets?
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: MARS AND JUPITER (in any order)High School Round 3 Page 7

content:
What is the most common term used to describe the velocity of an object
at any one discrete moment along its path?
subject: PHYSICS

content: What lepton was the first to be discovered?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
A beaker of concentrated aqueous ammonia is placed next to a
beaker of concentrated aqueous hydrochloric acid at room temperature. After a short while, a white
cloud forms between the beakers. This is a demonstration of:
W) effusion
X) diffusion
Y) efflorescence
Z) effervescence
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
In addition to the “sniff test”, which of the following is a standard
laboratory test for a sulfide, such as hydrogen sulfide gas:
W) the gas passed over a filter paper soaked in colorless lead nitrate turns the paper brown
X) when inserted into a flame, a glowing wooden splint bursts into flames
Y) a flame test gives off a deep purple color
Z) paper chromatography
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: W) THE GAS PASSED OVER A FILTER PAPER SOAKED IN COLORLESS LEADNITRATE TURNS THE PAPER BROWN(Solution: H S + Pb(NO ) ) 2HNO + PbS )2 (g) 3 2(aq) 3 (s)High School Round 3 Page 8

content:
Which of the following would BEST describe the quaternary structure
of collagen:
W) fibrous
X) globular
Y) planar
Z) transport
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following BEST describes what the term virulence
means:
W) the specificity of a virus to cause disease in a certain host
X) the ability of a microbe to cause cellular damage
Y) any transmissible disease caused by a microbe
Z) the degree to which a microbe causes disease or harm to its host
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Z) THE DEGREE TO WHICH A MICROBE CAUSES DISEASE OR HARM TO ITSHOST

content:
If triangle ABD is congruent with triangle EFG, which of the following
MUST be true:
W) side AB is congruent to side EF
X) side AD is congruent to side FG
Y) measure of angle B = measure of angle G
Z) measure of angle A = measure of angle G
subject: MATH
answer: W) SIDE AB IS CONGRUENT TO SIDE EF

content:
Simplify the following rational expression by combining like terms,
(x2 −16)
assuming x is not equal to 4:
(4x−x2)
x+4 x+4 −(x+4) − x−4
subject: MATH
answer: − (ACCEPT: or or )x − x x xHigh School Round 3 Page 9

content:
Which of the following best describes the luster of quartz:
W) dull
X) silky
Y) metallic
Z) vitreous
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is LEAST accurate regarding
earthquakes:
W) scientists agree that mega-quakes of magnitude 10 are very likely in the near future
X) the world’s greatest earthquake zone is the circum-Pacific seismic belt
Y) Alaska has the greatest number of earthquakes in the U.S.
Z) deep earthquakes are much less likely to be followed by aftershocks than shallow earthquakes
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: W) SCIENTISTS AGREE THAT MEGA-QUAKES OF MAGNITUDE 10 ARE LIKELYIN THE NEAR FUTURE

content:
Identify the following 3 fabrics as derived from animals or
plants, respectively: jute; linen; wool
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: JUTE = PLANTS; LINEN = PLANTS; WOOL = ANIMALS

content:
Rounded to the nearest whole degree, what is the obliquity of
the ecliptic?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
What is the proper name for the closest spiral galaxy to the Milky
Way?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
What is the common name for the 88 sections into which the
International Astronomical Society has divided the sky?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
In one cycle of alternating current, 180º is given to the point at what
fractional amount of the way through the cycle?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
If the speed of sound in a certain medium is 360 meters per second, what
is the wavelength, in meters, of a sound-wave that has a frequency of 60 hertz?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 6(Solution: wavelength = speed/f; = 360/60 = 6 meters)High School Round 3 Page 11

content:
Which of the following is a gas that is tested for by ignition in air
on contact with a lighted splint to produce a high-pitched “popping” sound:
W) oxygen
X) hydrogen
Y) helium
Z) nitrogen monoxide
subject: CHEMISTRY

content: The Lewis dot structure for the N+2 ion would show how many dots?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content: What is the scientific term given to the shape of the E. coli bacterium?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: BACILLUS (ACCEPT: ROD or BACILLI or BACILLIFORM)

content:
Name all of the following 4 plants that produce seeds with a fleshy
covering that are eaten by animals and dispersed in their droppings: apple; orchid; cherry; sphagnum
moss
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is NOT an endothermic process:
W) sublimation
X) melting
Y) vaporization
Z) condensation
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the molarity of a sodium hydroxide solution made by
dissolving 4 grams NaOH in 250 milliliters of water?
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: 0.4(Solution: 4.0 g (1 mole / 40 g) = 0.1; 0.1 moles/0.250 L = 0.4 M or moles/L)High School Round 3 Page 13
